text:
August 7, 1952
Mr. Frank E. Schooley
Bax 23k
Deltaville, Virginia
Bear Frank;
1 have your note of August 4th and I hope you will forgive
me for tracking you down to your cottage on the trail of
the lonesome pine.
Tou have undoubtedly seen the confidential memorandum from
Wilbur indicating that Janes Miles must go back to Purdue
November 15th. Please let me have your ideas concerning
a successor who wou'd be prepared to carry the project
through for a period of four years.
With best wishes.
Seymour N. Siegel
President
SNSjLG
P.S. The pressings of discs in the Jefferson series are
not meant to exclude the use of tape in the distribution
of the programs to our member stations. Discs are basically
promotional items which might also be income producing
insofar as commercial stations are concerned. 1 agree
with you that we ought not to delay things. A guy called
Edmund Burke said that "The only thing necessaiy for the
triumph of evil is that good men do nothing". Tou say it
in a much more succinct manner.
Have a good vacation,
